"Excuse me young man," she said, "But you just jumped ahead of me in line."
"Oh shut it you old hag," said Jerry, who gave the old gypsy lady little attention after this.
"Very well then," she said under her breath, "It seems you could afford to be taken down a few notches. I curse you to take the things people don't like about themselves, that should make you a bit more humble."
"Excuse me?" asked Jerry turning around, but the old lady was nowhere to be seen.
